MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable Sub OnRequestScheduleRecording (iAppServiceId As String, requestId As String, inputId As String, channelUri As Uri, programUri As Uri, params As Bundle)

public: virtual void OnRequestScheduleRecording(System::String ^ iAppServiceId, System::String ^ requestId, System::String ^ inputId, Android::Net::Uri ^ channelUri, Android::Net::Uri ^ programUri, Android::OS::Bundle ^ params);
public virtual void OnRequestScheduleRecording (string iAppServiceId, string requestId, string inputId, Android.Net.Uri channelUri, Android.Net.Uri programUri, Android.OS.Bundle params);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnRequestScheduleRecording(string iAppServiceId, string requestId, string inputId, class Android.Net.Uri channelUri, class Android.Net.Uri programUri, class Android.OS.Bundle params) cil managed

abstract member OnRequestScheduleRecording : string * string * string * Android.Net.Uri * Android.Net.Uri * Android.OS.Bundle -> unit override this.OnRequestScheduleRecording : string * string * string * Android.Net.Uri * Android.Net.Uri * Android.OS.Bundle -> unit

Docs.param: The ID of the TV interactive app service bound to this view.

The ID of this request which is used to match the corresponding response. The request ID in #notifyRecordingScheduled(String, String) for this request is the same as the ID sent here. This should be defined by the TIAS and can be any string. Should this API be called with the same requestId twice, both requests should be handled regardless by the TV application.
The ID of the TV input for the given channel.
The URI of a channel to be recorded.
The URI of the TV program to be recorded.
Domain-specific data for this tune request. Keys must be a scoped name, i.e. prefixed with a package name you own, so that different developers will not create conflicting keys.
Docs.summary: This is called when TvInteractiveAppService.Session#requestScheduleRecording(String, String, Uri, Uri, Bundle) is called.

remarks.para: This is called when TvInteractiveAppService.Session#requestScheduleRecording(String, String, Uri, Uri, Bundle) is called.

format.a: Java documentation for android.media.tv.interactive.TvInteractiveAppView.TvInteractiveAppCallback.onRequestScheduleRecording(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, android.net.Uri, android.net.Uri, android.os.Bundle).

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable Sub OnRequestScheduleRecording (iAppServiceId As String, requestId As String, inputId As String, channelUri As Uri, startTime As Long, duration As Long, repeatDays As RecordingWeekDays, params As Bundle)

public: virtual void OnRequestScheduleRecording(System::String ^ iAppServiceId, System::String ^ requestId, System::String ^ inputId, Android::Net::Uri ^ channelUri, long startTime, long duration, Android::Media::TV::RecordingWeekDays repeatDays, Android::OS::Bundle ^ params);

public virtual void OnRequestScheduleRecording (string iAppServiceId, string requestId, string inputId, Android.Net.Uri channelUri, long startTime, long duration, Android.Media.TV.RecordingWeekDays repeatDays, Android.OS.Bundle params);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnRequestScheduleRecording(string iAppServiceId, string requestId, string inputId, class Android.Net.Uri channelUri, int64 startTime, int64 duration, valuetype Android.Media.TV.RecordingWeekDays repeatDays, class Android.OS.Bundle params) cil managed

abstract member OnRequestScheduleRecording : string * string * string * Android.Net.Uri * int64 * int64 * Android.Media.TV.RecordingWeekDays * Android.OS.Bundle -> unit override this.OnRequestScheduleRecording : string * string * string * Android.Net.Uri * int64 * int64 * Android.Media.TV.RecordingWeekDays * Android.OS.Bundle -> unit
MemberSignature.Usage: tvInteractiveAppCallback.OnRequestScheduleRecording (iAppServiceId, requestId, inputId, channelUri, startTime, duration, repeatDays, params)

Docs.param: The ID of the TV interactive app service bound to this view.

The ID of this request which is used to match the corresponding response. The request ID in #notifyRecordingScheduled(String, String) for this request is the same as the ID sent here. This should be defined by the TIAS and can be any string. Should this API be called with the same requestId twice, both requests should be handled regardless by the TV application.
The ID of the TV input for the given channel.
The URI of a channel to be recorded.
The start time of the recording in milliseconds since epoch.
The duration of the recording in milliseconds.
The repeated days. 0 if not repeated.
Domain-specific data for this tune request. Keys must be a scoped name, i.e. prefixed with a package name you own, so that different developers will not create conflicting keys.
Docs.summary: This is called when TvInteractiveAppService.Session#requestScheduleRecording(String, String, Uri, long, long, int, Bundle) is called.

remarks.para: This is called when TvInteractiveAppService.Session#requestScheduleRecording(String, String, Uri, long, long, int, Bundle) is called.

format.a: Java documentation for android.media.tv.interactive.TvInteractiveAppView.TvInteractiveAppCallback.onRequestScheduleRecording(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, android.net.Uri, long, long, int, android.os.Bundle).
